title: Eliminating Waste and Saving Taxpayer Dollars by Consolidating Procurement

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to consolidate their purchasing of common goods and services through the General Services Administration (GSA) to reduce waste, duplication, and costs. It designates the GSA as the lead agency for government-wide contracts, particularly for information technology, to improve efficiency and save taxpayer dollars.
potential_concerns: Consolidation may lead to job losses or reassignments among federal procurement staff in agencies outside the GSA.
Centralizing procurement could create bottlenecks or single points of failure that slow down agency operations.
Smaller agencies or those with unique needs might face challenges or delays due to standardized purchasing processes.
Private vendors may experience reduced competition or increased barriers if procurement is overly centralized.
Implementation timelines and legal authorities may cause delays or resistance among agencies reluctant to relinquish procurement control.
